intro: Barleria kitchingii, commonly known as Kitching's barleria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple tubular flowers. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It is a perennial herb that thrives in full sun and is drought-tolerant. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
